text: Leave the nether realm and return to the mortal realm

title: Mission Description
content: Castorice, who became a demigod, successfully pushes (Trailblazer) gently out of the nether realm and welcomes the end of her fate.(Trailblazer) still remembers the promise they made with Castorice to meet her once more.

text: (EnterExploratory ExcursionThe Road Back to the Living)

children.text: (BeginHomeward Journey, Never Look Back Upon the Path Whence You Came)

text: Go to the moonlight. Castorice is beckoning for you

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I'm... back.)

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing animation

speaker: Castorice
line: At last... I knew you could do it.

speaker: Castorice
line: Your soul is still perfectly whole, as if some kind of force is trying its best to keep it together.

speaker: Castorice
line: Is it Oronyx 's final blessing? Or... is it a miracle of your own?

speaker: Castorice
line: It's truly... incredible. Such a strange surge of familiarity... so hard to describe.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Perhaps it is fate, once again fulfilling its own design. Or perhaps it is the laws from beyond the sky, so familiar to you, (Trailblazer), that intertwined our destinies long ago...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...It seems that this is a riddle which cannot be solved anytime soon.

speaker: Castorice
line: The sensation of becoming a demigod is truly wondrous. It's as if the River of Souls is winding its way through the depths of my spirit, transforming with each breath into a fine rain that nourishes the world...

speaker: Castorice
line: Do you recall that prophecy? "At the end of the sea of flowers, the souls of the living shall warm thy fingertips, and after an embrace... there shall be eternal separation."

speaker: Castorice
line: I promised you that I would do everything in my power to give it another meaning. Now, as I stand as a demigod and destiny draws to a close...

speaker: Castorice
line: I can finally end it in a way that is as beautiful as it deserves.

speaker: Castorice
line: The wish I once sought but could never grasp is now within reach. In this brand-new world, every blooming life will lift its arms in celebration, and recount the profound meaning of this very instant...

speaker: Castorice
line: Every touch, every embrace we share, will never again be an ice-cold loss...

speaker: Castorice
line: They will radiate with an intense warmth, sowing love far and wide throughout the land.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: The other shore... is very cold.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: May I borrow your warmth... one last time?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Thank you for fulfilling this wish of mine.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: The place I'll be going to is what humans call the land of sorrows.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: But with this heartbeat, and the residual heat of this embrace...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I shall turn the nether realm into a gentle place of rest.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: This embrace may be brief, but it's the proof that I once "lived."

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Farewell, then. May we... reunite in the new world.

text: Listen to the conversation between Aglaea and Anaxa

title: Step Description
content: The events in the citizens' assembly come to a temporary halt, and the Flame-Chase Journey will continue. TheCouncil of Eldershas suffered a heavy blow — and the one behind it all, Anaxagoras, is about to face the final judgment.Only at the very last moment can Aglaea and Anaxa finally break down the barriers between them.

speaker: Aglaea
line: That grand and absurd performance was what you've been seeking your whole life?

speaker: Anaxa
line: I gave up everything in search of truth, and it culminated in this very moment.

speaker: Anaxa
line: You, on the other hand, performed as I expected. You did not hesitate when you saw the chance to attain power. It's as if you...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Crave power like a fly craves rot.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Those are your words, not mine.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But what you said at the end... Did you already know what I had planned for Phainon ?

speaker: Anaxa
line: I may have lost an eye, but my vision is clearer than anyone else. You've nearly exhausted your humanity. You're no different from my current state as a walking corpse.

speaker: Aglaea
line: That's true. I've long since burned to ash over the past one thousand years. Only he is capable of unleashing a raging fire that rivals our final great enemy — Aquila .

speaker: Anaxa
line: So, this is our last chance. How about we let go of the bad blood between us?

speaker: Anaxa
line: May I resonate with your Coreflame , Aglaea?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Please do.

speaker: Anaxa
line: That's... impossible. To persist with your soul thinned to such an extent... You're insane.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Just as you fight to lug your corpse onward to complete your unfinished goals, I have my own reasons for doing this.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Until Phainon grows into his position as the prophesied leader, I must continue to lead everyone on the Flame-Chase Journey. I must keep inching forward, even if only as an empty shell.

speaker: Anaxa
line: I've long predicted this was the case, but I didn't think you'd already lost so much.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh, how ironic. We would have avoided so many misunderstandings if you and I had just spoken this candidly before.

speaker: Anaxa
line: But casting aside our ideological differences, there is one thing you and I agree on.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Yes. He was born to be a hero. He understands the hearts of the people, and I can confidently say he is a far better leader than you. Only he is capable of fulfilling your mission.

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...Sadly, he is a man cursed by Mnestia . But by my estimates, his horribly elaborate sense of style should not impede Era Nova.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Congratulations are in order. We've found common ground at the very end of our destined paths.

speaker: Anaxa
line: When you put it that way, it makes me want to take back what I said.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea! We're back!

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Come welcome (Trailblazer), our great hero reborn from the ashes.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I hope he didn't hear your earlier assessment.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, it wouldn't be the first time I criticized him. A man should be aware of his own shortcomings.

text:
(ObtainCoreflame of Death)
(UnlockAchievementUnmoor and Sail Away From the Underworld)

speaker: Aglaea
line: I'm gladdened by your triumphant return...

speaker: Aglaea
line: But... I don't see Castorice among your number.

speaker: Anaxa
line: It looks like she not only helped me prove my theory, but helped you fulfill your mission as well.

text: She finally understood her origins and completed her trial.
I believe she'll always be at our side.

speaker: Aglaea
line: She might not have been able to change her fate, but she still wrote the final verse of her epic herself.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ Trinnon , please recite the prophecy for us. (Trailblazer), please surrender that scalding Coreflame for us as well.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You are the only life she ever saved by her own hand in her one thousand years on this earth. I believe no one is more qualified for this noble task.

speaker: Trinnon
line: O! Gods who have returned, and gods who are still watching! Today, we bring you a soul laid bare.

speaker: Trinnon
line: The Hand of Shadow, Thanatos , remembered their name from the past! From daylight they came and to their fragrant dwelling they return, to walk now among your ranks.

speaker: Trinnon
line: ▶ And there was one who joined hands with the Titan . A traveler risen from the dead and reborn among mortal kind. ( He / She ) is the everlasting night and shall now proclaim in ( his / her ) good name:

speaker: Trinnon
line: "O majesty of the Twelve Titans, pillars of the world—"

speaker: Trinnon
line: "We seek your divinity, to mend the rifts of the world —"

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Fill our bodies with blood of gold, till we wither in willing service to the prophecy..."

speaker: Trinnon
line: Step forward, Trailblazer from beyond the sky. And together with us ...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Surrender the Coreflame and carve their star into the sky.

speaker: Phainon
line: A constellation for Death...

speaker: Anaxa
line: For Life and Death, to be more precise.

speaker: Phainon
line: Look! It's...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is that... Castorice?

speaker: Anaxa
line: No, it's only a Divine Echo. I think she's here for the trial.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Phainon
line: What did she say?

speaker: Trinnon
line: That's the language of the Titans...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Castorice... No, the Titan...

speaker: Trinnon
line: They said...

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "...I have illuminated the cold shadow of death."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Onwards. For your path to the future is bright and its flame eternal."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Do not forget..."

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh, she made quite a scene. I suppose it's my turn now.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I won't stop you...

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor, you...

speaker: Anaxa
line: What's with that look? You were present.

speaker: Anaxa
line: So, let's get this execution over with. We wouldn't want to bring shame to Okhema's divine laws or keep me from creating a new world.

speaker: Phainon
line: You never change, do you, Professor?

speaker: Phainon
line: I don't understand. If your theory is correct, you'll lose all memories of your past life once you become a Titan, so what's the point of becoming a god?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Of course there's a point. Even if I forget who I am, I'll still have my brilliant mind.

speaker: Anaxa
line: It goes without saying I'll find a way to retrieve memories of my past life. Besides, I still have you, don't I?

speaker: Phainon
line: I still don't really understand what you said during the assembly. Even if it were true, things reforged from memory could never be the same as the original anyway.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Then allow me to tell you right now that you're wrong.

speaker: Anaxa
line: What exactly are we? My answer is that the Chrysos Heirs are the future Titans, and vice versa. Of course, this answer only applies to us.

speaker: Anaxa
line: So, what are "we" when it comes to regular mortals?

speaker: Anaxa
line: The very essence of the world — our souls — are tiny invisible seeds that hold records of each person's memories of the world, and "we" are the buds that sprout from these seeds to grow into great trees.

speaker: Phainon
line: Is that what Nousporism means?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Correct. Once our physical bodies are born, we become new extensions of the world. From there, we plant our seeds into someone's memories and then scatter them into the hearts of countless people in the future.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Just as seeds are affected by their environment, so too will our appearances differ across memories. But the partial memories we carry will always be the same, because that is just how the world is.

speaker: Anaxa
line: To destroy our very existence, one must destroy the world itself. But we have someone who will still live on with his perfect memory...

speaker: Anaxa
line: That person is you, child of Kephale . This is what it means to be the Worldbearing Titan.

speaker: Anaxa
line: So, carry everything of this world and live on. Don't disappoint those most precious to you. Don't disappoint Lady Goldweaver.

speaker: Anaxa
line: And especially don't bring dishonor to my theory.

speaker: Phainon
line: Anaxa, I swear to you. I'll lead everyone to our reunion in the new world.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, good.

speaker: Anaxa
line: That's all I have to say. Farewell, everyone. May we meet again in the next life.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Farewell, Great Performer. May Cerces safeguard your thoughts.

text: Salute him in the same way.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ May Cerces safeguard your thoughts.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Are you satisfied, honorable Titan?

speaker: Cerces
line: Very. I hereby swear I have borne witness: Anaxagoras of the Nousporists and the Grove of Epiphany has successfully overcome the trial of Reason.

speaker: Cerces
line: Thus, I shall confer upon you these words.

speaker: Cerces
line: "You shall transcend the peaks of purity and return to corruption and hardship."

speaker: Anaxa
line: Oh, so that's a god's prophecy? It sounds like you just rephrased my past, present, and future.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Oh, Cerces, Cerces. Is that all you've got?

speaker: Cerces
line: Well, you've already "transcended the peaks of purity" and you were never the type to give me any leeway.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, that is true.

speaker: Cerces
line: But I do still have one question.

speaker: Anaxa
line: I knew it...

speaker: Anaxa
line: What is it? Maybe we're thinking of the same thing.

speaker: Cerces
line: As you've so boldly stated, we and the world itself live on through the memories of others.

speaker: Cerces
line: If that is the case, whose memories did the very first Nouspore sprout from?

speaker: Anaxa
line: How should I know?

speaker: Cerces
line: Oh my...

speaker: Anaxa
line: But since we are both equally curious...

speaker: Anaxa
line: We should allow the children of humanity who come after us to investigate in our stead.

children.speaker: Anaxa
children.line: I will sow the seeds of "Suspicion" in the new world with your soul —

children.speaker: Anaxa
children.line: "...And now, the objective is complete. That is all."

text: Listen to the discussion between Black Swan and Himeko

title: Step Description
content: March 7th's condition seems to be getting worse.Black Swan still seems to be hiding something... What doesAmphoreusmean to theGarden of Recollection? And why is it so important?

speaker: Black Swan
line: ...Thankfully, she's still alive.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Was March 7th also in this condition when she was first rescued by the Express ?

speaker: Himeko
line: Her condition was very similar. It's just that at that time, the Express did not have a Memokeeper who could diagnose her condition.

speaker: Black Swan
line: But she still woke up naturally. Looking on the bright side, that might happen this time as well.

speaker: Himeko
line: When March awakened from the ice, her memories were completely wiped clean. I want to prepare for the worst and prevent something like that from happening again.

speaker: Himeko
line: Can you share with us your hypothesis?

speaker: Black Swan
line: I do not have conclusive evidence, but judging by her current condition...

speaker: Black Swan
line: Perhaps March 7th's memories have been hijacked.

speaker: Himeko
line: Hijacked?

speaker: Black Swan
line: Think about it, Miss Himeko. What will happen when someone loses their ability to remember?

speaker: Himeko
line: I'm not a biologist, but I hear that there's of a species of fish on Vonwacq that has the memory span of less than a second. It forgets anything that occurs in the very next instant. Perhaps something similar will happen?

speaker: Black Swan
line: Unfortunately, short-term memory is an entirely different concept from the inability to remember. Perhaps it is difficult for you to imagine...

speaker: Black Swan
line: But an individual who has lost their ability to remember turns into nothingness.

speaker: Himeko
line: Nothingness?

speaker: Black Swan
line: The belief of the Garden is that everything in this universe can be interpreted through memories. This is the driving force behind the continuance of this Path.

speaker: Black Swan
line: The past is made up of memoria while the future is a possibility that will eventually be converted to memoria. But the present... it doesn't really exist and is only an abstract expression.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Therefore, when a person is affected by the Path and loses their ability to remember... their physical form will also be affected. These ice crystals are a manifestation of that.

speaker: Himeko
line: ...Miss Black Swan, there is one thing that I haven't looked into deeply until now.

speaker: Himeko
line: You've guided us to Amphoreus but refused to tell us your true intentions. "Collecting memories"... is simply not a convincing answer.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Is Miss Himeko suspicious of me?

speaker: Himeko
line: I mean no offense. I am merely speculating. But I'd appreciate your honesty, if possible.

speaker: Black Swan
line: In other words, now is the time for me to prove my innocence...

speaker: Black Swan
line: That's not a problem, of course. The true reason behind my intentions is that Amphoreus holds special significance. For some Memokeepers of the Garden with extremist views, it... is a "perfect example."

speaker: Himeko
line: Perfect example?

speaker: Black Swan
line: A world that can only be seen through the Garden's mirror means that Memokeepers have the right to keep the world in their private collection. If those pathstriders of Remembrance were to uncover the secrets of Amphoreus first...

speaker: Black Swan
line: They might unleash their wild ambitions and remodel more worlds into a similar form.

speaker: Himeko
line: So, the reason you did everything you could to convince the Express to come to this starzone is just to uncover the secrets and foil the plans of these people?

speaker: Black Swan
line: I chose to remain quiet before because I did not want to involve you in the Garden's internal conflicts.

speaker: Himeko
line: Remodeling a world is no easy feat. These extremists likely aren't just simple pathstriders. Do they wield the powers of Emanators ?

speaker: Black Swan
line: You can be even bolder with your guesses. The people that I'm talking about... They aren't just individuals. They are an organization that has already attached itself to the pinky finger of Fuli .

speaker: Himeko
line: Could they be the ones who hijacked March 7th's memories?

speaker: Black Swan
line: I cannot be certain, but at the very least, they are capable of doing so.

speaker: Black Swan
line: I am deeply sorry about what has happened to March 7th, but the deal that I proposed still remains a fair one. Amphoreus is still an excellent destination, and investigating further might allow us to uncover the truth behind the accident.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Miss Himeko, the wisest choice right now is for us to continue cooperating...

speaker: Himeko
line: What's wrong?

speaker: Black Swan
line: ...Let me take back a part of what I said just now, Miss Himeko.

speaker: Black Swan
line: Although we indeed struck a deal, it seems like I have involved you in some unforeseen danger... Please accept my deepest apologies.

speaker: Himeko
line: Has something changed?

speaker: Black Swan
line: It's Fuli... THEIR gaze has just swept across Amphoreus.

text: Clearly, Amphoreus poses quite the intriguing "question" — one compelling enough to push THAT genius into action...
